docs.title: Battle of Midgard Twitch & Discord Bot Documentation
docs.text:
The Battle of Midgard Twitch & Discord Bot is a bot that has been built for the VanderwoodTV Twitch channel. The bot is built mainly using the TwitchIO, discord.py and the tortoise-orm libraries.

The bot has been built and coded by Adam Birds of ADB Web Designs.

The documentation for the bot has been created using Material for MkDocs.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text: The bot has a number of commands that are available to the streamer, moderators, subscribers and normal viewers.

docs.title: Streamer Commands
docs.text: • ?registerchannel - Registers the channel for the Battle of Midgard game.

docs.title: Moderator Commands
docs.text:
• ?createclan - Creates a clan which viewers can join in the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?add - Adds a viewer to a clan in the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?remove - Removes a viewer from a clan in the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?startseason - Starts a new season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?endseason - Ends the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?startsession - Starts a new session of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?endsession - Ends the current session of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?setdate - Sets the end date of the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?addvp - Adds valor points to the viewer for the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?removevp - Removes valor points from the viewer for the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?addrewardlevel - Adds a reward level to the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?editrewardlevel - Edits a reward level in the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?removerewardlevel - Removes a reward level from the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?startraid - Starts a raid in the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?endraid - Ends a raid in the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?clip - Creates a clip of the current stream.
  • ?lucky - Announces the winner of the Wheel of Hamingja in the discord server.

docs.title: Subscriber Commands
docs.text: • ?join - Joins the Battle of Midgard game and get randomly assigned to a clan.

docs.title: Viewer Commands
docs.text:
• ?rank - Displays the Top 10 players in the clan for the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?standings - Displays the current clan standings for the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?overallrank - Displays the top 10 players across all clans for the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?myrank - Displays the current season points, lifetime points, clan rank and overall rank for the viewer.
  • ?dates - Displays the start and end dates for the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?mvp - Displays the MVP from the previous season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?checkin - Checks the viewer into the current session of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?giftedsubleaderboard - Displays the top 10 viewers who have gifted the most subs.
  • ?raid - Checks the viewer into the current raid of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?help - Displays a link to this documentation.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Ubuntu 20.04 or later
  • Python 3.10 or later
  • PostgreSQL 13 or later
  • Nginx

docs.title: Installation Steps
docs.text:
1. Clone or download the repository.

  2. Create a Python virtual environment and install the dependencies.

    python3 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
pip install -r requirements.txt

  3. Create a PostgreSQL database and user.

    sudo -u postgres psql
CREATE DATABASE battleofmidgard;
CREATE USER battleofmidgard WITH PASSWORD 'password';
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON DATABASE battleofmidgard TO battleofmidgard;

  4. Make a copy of config.yml.example and rename it to config.yml.

    cp example.config.yaml config.yaml

  5. Edit config.yaml and add in the database credentials and details.

  6. Edit config.yaml and enter the twitch access token, client id and client secret.

  7. Edit config.yaml and enter the twitch channel name and id to connect to.

  8. Edit config.yaml and enter your callback URL.

  9. Edit config.yaml and fill out the other details.

  10. Configure Nginx to proxy this application using the example-nginx-virtualhost.conf file.

  11. Run the database migrations.

    aerich upgrade

  12. Run the application.

    python3 bot.py

docs.title: Enabling as a Systemd Service
docs.text:
1. Copy the vanderwood-twitch-bot.service file to /etc/systemd/system/.

  2. Edit the file and change the WorkingDirectory and ExecStart paths to match your installation.

  3. Reload the systemd daemon.

    sudo systemctl daemon-reload

  4. Enable the service.

    sudo systemctl enable vanderwood-twitch-bot.service

  5. Start the service.

    sudo systemctl start vanderwood-twitch-bot.service

docs.title: Updating
docs.text:
1. Pull the latest changes from the repository.

  2. Run the database migrations.

    aerich upgrade

  3. Restart the application.

    sudo systemctl restart vanderwood-twitch-bot.service

docs.title: Commands
docs.text: The bot has a number of commands that are available to the streamer, moderators, subscribers and normal viewers.

docs.title: Streamer Commands
docs.text: The streamer commands are available to the streamer only, and can be found here.

docs.title: Moderator Commands
docs.text: The moderator commands are available to the streamer and moderators only, and can be found here.

docs.title: Subscriber Commands
docs.text: The subscriber commands are available to the streamer, moderators and subscribers only, and can be found here.

docs.title: Viewer Commands
docs.text: The viewer commands are available to everyone and can be found here.

docs.title: Moderator Commands
docs.text:
The following commands are available to the streamer and moderators only:

  • ?createclan - Creates a clan which viewers can join in the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?add - Adds a viewer to a clan in the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?remove - Removes a viewer from a clan in the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?startseason - Starts a new season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?endseason - Ends the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?startsession - Starts a new session of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?endsession - Ends the current session of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?setdate - Sets the end date of the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?addvp - Adds valor points to the viewer for the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?removevp - Removes valor points from the viewer for the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?addrewardlevel - Adds a reward level to the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?editrewardlevel - Edits a reward level in the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?removerewardlevel - Removes a reward level from the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?startraid - Starts a raid in the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?endraid - Ends a raid in the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?clip - Creates a clip of the current stream.
  • ?lucky - Announces the winner of the Wheel of Hamingja in the discord server.

docs.title: Add Player to Clan
docs.text: The ?add command is used to add a player to a clan for the Battle of Midgard game.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: ?add <clan tag> <player>

docs.title: Example
docs.text: ?add THOR vanderwoodtv

docs.title: Permissions
docs.text: The ?add command can only be used by moderators or the streamer.

docs.title: Add Reward Level
docs.text: The ?addrewardlevel command is used to add a reward level to the Battle of Midgard game.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: ?addrewardlevel <level> <reward>

docs.title: Example
docs.text: ?addrewardlevel 1 10% off your next purchase!

docs.title: Permissions
docs.text: The ?addrewardlevel command can only be used by moderators or the streamer.

docs.title: Add Valor Points
docs.text: The ?addvp command is used to add valor points to a player for the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: ?addvp <player> <points>

docs.title: Example
docs.text: ?addvp vanderwoodtv 100

docs.title: Permissions
docs.text: The ?addvp command can be used by moderators or the streamer.

docs.title: Set End Date
docs.text: The ?setdate command is used to set the end date of the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: ?setdate <DD/MM/YYYY>

docs.title: Example
docs.text: ?setdate 31/12/2022

docs.title: Permissions
docs.text: The ?setdate command can only be used by moderators or the streamer.

docs.title: Streamer Commands
docs.text:
The following commands are available to the streamer only:

  • ?registerchannel - Registers the channel to be used for the Battle of Midgard game.

docs.title: Register Channel
docs.text: The ?registerchannel command is used to register the channel to be used for the Battle of Midgard game. This only needs to be used once.

docs.title: Subscriber Commands
docs.text:
The following commands are available to the subscriber only:

  • ?join - Joins the Battle of Midgard game and get randomly assigned to a clan.

docs.title: Viewer Commands
docs.text:
The viewer commands are available to everyone:

  • ?rank - Displays the Top 10 players in the clan for the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?standings - Displays the current clan standings for the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?overallrank - Displays the top 10 players across all clans for the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?myrank - Displays the current season points, lifetime points, clan rank and overall rank for the viewer.
  • ?dates - Displays the start and end dates for the current season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?mvp - Displays the MVP from the previous season of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?checkin - Checks the viewer into the current session of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?raid - Checks the viewer into the current raid of the Battle of Midgard game.
  • ?giftedsubleaderboard - Displays the top 10 viewers who have gifted the most subs.
  • ?help - Displays a link to this documentation.
